meanings.definition: Drive back (an attack or attacking enemy) by force.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight repulses the dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers repulse the invaders with their strong defense.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs repulses me, but some people enjoy it.
meanings.sent4: The bright light repulses the darkness, revealing the hidden path.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the fireworks repulses the birds, scattering them in the sky.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel intense distaste and aversion.
meanings.sent1: The foul smell repulses the guests at the party.
meanings.sent2: The sight of blood repulses some people.
meanings.sent3: The idea of swimming in a lake full of fish repulses him, but he loves the ocean.
meanings.sent4: The dishonesty of the politician repulses the voters, leading to his defeat.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine repulses the child, making it hard for the parent to give it to them.
